channel.title: Trading Strategy / @TradingProtocol
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @TradingProtocol. Generated by nitter.freedit.eu

item.title:
RT by @TradingProtocol: 8/ Domain Expertise & Data (On-Chain & Off-Chain)
At the end of the day, it comes down to data and domain expertise. More data means means better results. More domain specific data, means better domain specific results. This is where projects like @TradingProtocol are different from the current approach to AI Agents in DeFi. Instead of the simplistic approach of prompting a LLM ‚Äî with TradingProtocol you can leverage existing quantitative models to execute automated trades. The best part is that the data on which these models are trained on is open source, allowing you to create your own quantitative models.
One could imagine that a better solution to the DeFAI / AiFi meta would be to have a conversational agent leverage an existing trading strategy ‚Ä¶ or survey the response of an existing quantitative models‚Ä¶ to provide better feedback to the user on a particular asset.
item.dc:creator: @irvinxyz
item.description:
8/ Domain Expertise & Data (On-Chain & Off-Chain)

At the end of the day, it comes down to data and domain expertise. More data means means better results. More domain specific data, means better domain specific results. This is where projects like @TradingProtocol are different from the current approach to AI Agents in DeFi. Instead of the simplistic approach of prompting a LLM ‚Äî with TradingProtocol you can leverage existing quantitative models to execute automated trades. The best part is that the data on which these models are trained on is open source, allowing you to create your own quantitative models.

One could imagine that a better solution to the DeFAI / AiFi meta would be to have a conversational agent leverage an existing trading strategy ‚Ä¶ or survey the response of an existing quantitative models‚Ä¶ to provide better feedback to the user on a particular asset.

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 16/ WHY TRADING STRATEGY?
Trading Strategy's Base datasets enable quant developers to create, backtest, and optimise their algorithmic trading strategies with familiar tooling:
- First-class Python and data research support
- Local development, bring-your-own-tools model
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
16/ WHY TRADING STRATEGY?

Trading Strategy's Base datasets enable quant developers to create, backtest, and optimise their algorithmic trading strategies with familiar tooling:

- First-class Python and data research support

- Local development, bring-your-own-tools model

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 15/ - Uniswap CLMM data for LP and market-making strategies
- Token quality data (risk score, labelling)
- Cross-referencing with CoinGecko and TokenSniffer
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
15/ - Uniswap CLMM data for LP and market-making strategies

- Token quality data (risk score, labelling)

- Cross-referencing with CoinGecko and TokenSniffer

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 10/ Base is best what EVM technology can offer today
- Gas efficient: low transaction cost
- Immune to MEV, frontrunning and other public mempool-based malicious activities
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
10/ Base is best what EVM technology can offer today

- Gas efficient: low transaction cost

- Immune to MEV, frontrunning and other public mempool-based malicious activities

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 9/ Base comes with hiqh quality assetes and protocols
- Native USDC support
- Native Coinbase Wrapped Bitcoin (cbBTC) support
- Home for well-established DeFi protocols like Uniswap, Aerodrome, Aave Fast: low transaction latency
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
9/ Base comes with hiqh quality assetes and protocols

- Native USDC support

- Native Coinbase Wrapped Bitcoin (cbBTC) support

- Home for well-established DeFi protocols like Uniswap, Aerodrome, Aave
Fast: low transaction latency

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 7/ WHY BASE
Base is very good chain for traders. Some benefits of Base L2 include:
- Vast variety of different assets to trade (we list 56,000 active trading pairs out of 1 million)
- Good volumes
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:

Base is very good chain for traders. Some benefits of Base L2 include:

- Good volumes

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 6/ Thus, there was not much to do if you wanted to trade EVM.
Not until Base came around last year.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
6/ Thus, there was not much to do if you wanted to trade EVM.

Not until Base came around last year.

item.title: R to @TradingProtocol: 5/ Meanwhile there has been a reneissance of new EVM-based chains, layer ones and twos. The problem is that these chains usually carry a very small set of their native assets which do not have much uptake outside the small audience of the chain bagholders.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description: 5/ Meanwhile there has been a reneissance of new EVM-based chains, layer ones and twos. The problem is that these chains usually carry a very small set of their native assets which do not have much uptake outside the small audience of the chain bagholders.

item.title: R to @TradingProtocol: 4/ Solana has risen as the competitor for EVM technologies, but its DeFi ecosystem is still much under devellopment.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description: 4/ Solana has risen as the competitor for EVM technologies, but its DeFi ecosystem is still much under devellopment.

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 3/ For long time, onchain trading has been hold back: Ethereum mainnet has most liquidity, but it is gas efficient, or too expensive, to trade anything but yield farming.
Or the ticket size vs. gas cost is too high for most.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
3/ For long time, onchain trading has been hold back: Ethereum mainnet has most liquidity, but it is gas efficient, or too expensive, to trade anything but yield farming.

Or the ticket size vs. gas cost is too high for most.

item.title:
R to @TradingProtocol: 2/ Trading Strategy has been building tools for onchain algoritmic trading for a while.
DeFi has been playing catch up with centralised exchanges. This is now finally changing, with blockchains reaching better techological maturity.
item.dc:creator: @TradingProtocol
item.description:
2/ Trading Strategy has been building tools for onchain algoritmic trading for a while.

DeFi has been playing catch up with centralised exchanges. This is now finally changing, with blockchains reaching better techological maturity.
